text: Are there any 2019 news about the API endpoint to search by custom properties? A glimpse of hope, a beta, anything?
What are you referring to by custom properties?
I'm also in need of this for getting companies via a custom property

This is definitely on our radar as we know there are some really good use cases for this.  Just so I can capture everything effectively to help prioritize this for you, do you mind sharing your use cases with me <@UFCEFABV5> and <@U7V9DQ31P>?

I have a client that uses HubSpot to track referrals from their partners. I built a dashboard for their partners to track their referrals statuses (a custom property). Right now the dashboard is powered by dynamic contact lists. Then I have to filter out all the contacts with duplicate companies from the data before displaying the actual numbers on the dashboard.
Ideally, I'd be able to pull multiple companies directly via a custom property and not have to use the contacts APIs
for further clarification: they credit their partners per company, not per contact.
So if you had something like `/companies/v2/getAll?referrals=partnerA`, would that work?

My use case is dedup based on a custom property (a unique tax id)
My client uses partner referrals as in Stefen's case, and there's a fat chance that the same company may be referred by different partners

The goal is to check whether we have a specific tax ID in our portal and accept/reject the submission off of it

> What are you referring to by custom properties?

the contact and company properties I define by myself, as opposed to a predefined set of searchable properties now (contact's email address, first and last name, phone number, and company name)
